definition: Goguryeo (37 BC-668 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
variant of 勾[gou1]
beautiful
Korea

sentences.english: The people of Koguryo is one of the ancient minorities in northeast area of China.
sentences.chinese: 高句丽民族是我国东北地区的古老少数民族之一。

sentences.english: It is the key to accurate grasp the characteristics of style and skill in studying Gaogouli s murals of ancient graves.
sentences.chinese: 研究高句丽古墓壁画，准确把握其风格技法是关键。

sentences.english: The Koguryo revival ('boom') hit the right cord with the youth of Korea.
sentences.chinese: 复兴高句丽的热潮在韩国年轻人中掀起波澜。

sentences.english: After so many years of neglect and plunder, the past glory of Koguryo is fast disappearing.
sentences.chinese: 经多年之乎视与劫掠，高句丽昔日之荣光正日渐消逝。

sentences.english: It also formed a part of the Goguryeo kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 它还是高句丽王城的一部分。

sentences.english: Apartments stand where Koguryo castles used to stand.
sentences.chinese: 新的公寓正矗立在原来高句丽城堡所在之地。

sentences.english: Fuyu people which integrated with Huimo and some Hans were the main part of the Five Bus of GaoGouli.
sentences.chinese: 高句丽五部以夫余人为主，融合了秽貊及部分汉族。

sentences.english: Goguryeo army could not withstand, and Liaodong fall.
sentences.chinese: 高句丽军抵挡不住了，辽东陷落。

definition: Paekche or Baekje (18 BC-660 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Korean Goryeo dynasty, 918-1392/Korea, esp. in context of art and culture
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Turkic ethnic group
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
variant of 高句麗|高句丽[Gao1 gou1 li2]
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Wuhuan (nomadic tribe)
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Eastern barbarian/ancient ethnic group of northeast frontier of China
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
Han of the Five dynasties (951-979), one of ten kingdoms during the Five Dynasties, Ten Kingdoms period (907-960)
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
